009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Collection;
013import java.util.Deque;
014import java.util.LinkedList;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.PriorityQueue;
017
018import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
019import imagingbook.common.util.bits.BitMap;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This class implements the "linear-time" ("local flooding")
024 * component tree algorithm described in [1].
025 * See Section 26.2.3 of [2] for a detailed description (Algs. 26.3 - 26.4).
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] D. Nister and H. Stewenius, "Linear Time Maximally Stable Extremal Regions", 
029 * Computer Vision - ECCV 2008. pp. 183-196, Springer Berlin/Heidelberg (2008).
030 * <br>
031 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 *
036 * @param <T> the type of properties to be attached to components
037 */
038public class ComponentTreeLinearTime<T> extends ComponentTree<T> {
039        
040        private final List<Component<T>> components;
041        private final Component<T> root;
042        
043        /**
044         * Constructor. 
045         * Creates a new component tree from a {@link PixelMap} representing
046         * a gray-level image.
047         * @param P a {@link PixelMap}
048         */
049        public ComponentTreeLinearTime(PixelMap P) {
050                components = new ArrayList<Component<T>>();
051                root = buildTree(P);
052        }
053        
054        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
055        
056        @Override
057        public Component<T> getRoot() {
058//              return components.get(components.size() - 1);   // root is the last component
059                return root;
060        }
061
062        @Override
063        public Collection<Component<T>> getComponents() {
064                return components;
065        }
066        
067        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
068
069        /**
070         * Creates the component set from a {@link PixelMap}.
071         * Modifies {@link #components}.
072         * The last item in {@link #components} is the root component.
073         * @param P the input image
074         */
075        private Component<T> buildTree(PixelMap P) {            
076                final BitMap V = new BitMap(P.width, P.height);         // "visited", all set to false by default
077                final PriorityQueue<Pixel> B = new PriorityQueue<>();   // heap of boundary points that is sorted by 'val'
078                final Deque<Component<T>> C = new LinkedList<>();               // stack of region components
079                
080                Pixel p = P.getPixel(0, 0);                             // start point (seed), could be any pixel
081                V.set(p); //p.setVisited();                                     // p is the current point, mark as accessible
082                C.push(makeComponent(p.val));                           // push an empty component onto stack
083                
084                while (p != null) {                                                     // repeat until all pixels are done
085                        Pixel n = p.getNextNeighbor();                  // get the next neighbor of p (pixels keep track of visited neighbors)
086                        while (n != null) {
087                                if (!V.get(n)) {                                        // (!n.isVisited())
088                                        V.set(n);                                               //n.setVisited();
089                                        if (n.val >= p.val) {           
090                                                B.add(n);                                       // add neighbor to the boundary heap
091                                        }
092                                        else {
093                                                B.add(p);                                                       // move current pixel back to boundary heap 
094                                                C.push(makeComponent(n.val));   // create an empty component for the neighbor pixel
095                                                p = n;                                                          // make neighbor the current pixel
096                                        }
097                                }
098                                n = p.getNextNeighbor();
099                        }
100                        
101                        C.peek().addPoint(p);                                   // add the current pixel to the top-of-stack component
102                        
103                        Pixel q = B.poll();                                             // remove the first point from the heap of boundary pixels
104                        if (q != null && q.val > p.val) {               // new pixel value (q) is greater than current value (p)
105                                processStack(q.val, C);                         // see below
106                        }
107                        p = q;                                                                  // update the current pixel
108                }
109                
110                if (C.size() != 1) {    // just to make sure!
111                        throw new RuntimeException("component stack size must be 1 but is " + C.size());
112                }
113                Component<T> r = C.peek();                                      // the root component is still on the stack
114                processStack(Integer.MAX_VALUE, C);             // process the root component
115                
116                return r;
117        }
118        
119
120        
121        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
122
123        /**
124         * This method is called whenever the current pixel value is raised.
125         * Processes the top items on the component stack.
126         * Modifies {@link #components}.
127         * @param v     new "target" level
128         * @param C component stack
129         */
130        private void processStack(int v, Deque<Component<T>> C) {
131                while (!C.isEmpty() && v > C.peek().getLevel()) {               
132                        Component<T> c1 = C.poll();     // retrieve the top-of-stack component
133                        components.add(c1);                             // "emit" component c1 (note: c1.parent == null)
134
135                        if (v < Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
136                                Component<T> c2 = (C.isEmpty() || v < C.peek().getLevel()) ?
137                                                makeComponent(v) :              // c2 = artificial component with level v
138                                                C.pop();                                // c2 = next component on the stack 
139                                
140                                // merge c1 into c2 (c2 becomes parent of c1)
141                                c2.addChild(c1);
142                                c2.addToSize(c1.getSize());
143                                c1.setParent(c2);
144                                C.push(c2);     // insert c2 into the stack C (again)
145                        }
146                }
147        }
148        
149        
150        private int nextComponentIndex = 0;
151        
152        private Component<T> makeComponent(int level) {
153                return new Component<>(level, nextComponentIndex++);
154        }
155
156}
